answers.answer: HiThanks for writing to the forum!Lumps under the skin which run in families are generally due to hereditary neurofibromatosis. Neurofibromas are lumps made of both nerve and fibrous tissue.Hope this helps. It is difficult to comment beyond this at this stage. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Arm Lumps that run in a family. What could they be? Under the skin, not skin-related. Diabetes runs in family as well. Yeast related? Cysts? Immune response? Thrombosis? Phlebitis?
title: Lumps in arms (not armpits) not skin...deeper. runs in family
